content:
• Wednesday, December 28, 2011
  • MOS

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) says it will cut its quarterly finished phosphate production by up to 250,0000...

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) says it will cut its quarterly finished phosphate production by up to 250,0000 tons, or ~10%, until the end of March as excess supply weighs on market prices. "The current spot prices in this market do not reflect our outlook for the business, nor do we think they are sustainable," CEO Jim Prokopanko says. MOS -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 3 Comments
  • FSIN

    Chinese wire manufacturer Fushi Copperweld (NASDAQ:FSIN) rises 10.3% AH, to $8.23, after a group...

    Chinese wire manufacturer Fushi Copperweld (NASDAQ:FSIN) rises 10.3% AH, to $8.23, after a group of investors that includes co-CEO Li Fu lift their buyout offer for the company by $0.25/share, to $9.50/share. More than the increase in the buyout price, Fushi shares appear to be rallying on account of the new offer raising investor hopes that a deal will actually go through. (November offer)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • EXAR

    Chipmaker Exar (NASDAQ:EXAR) drops 3.3% AH after warning it expects FQ3 revenue of $28M-$30M and...

    Chipmaker Exar (NASDAQ:EXAR) drops 3.3% AH after warning it expects FQ3 revenue of $28M-$30M and a gross margin of 48%-50%, below prior guidance of $32M-$34M and 49%-51%. The company blames "weaker economic conditions in Asia and Europe and continued inventory corrections."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • CCM

    Concord Medical Services (CCM +14.4%) jumps after saying appraisal work for the acquisition of...

    Concord Medical Services (CCM +14.4%) jumps after saying appraisal work for the acquisition of Chang'an Hospital should be complete during early 2012. The deal was anticipated to close, nearer to, but no later than the first half of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • RGC

    Movie theaters are on pace to hit a 16-year low for tickets sold after stay-at-home options gain...

    Movie theaters are on pace to hit a 16-year low for tickets sold after stay-at-home options gain favor over 3-D movies and titles that offer little more than a rehash of familiar tales and characters. This year's projected haul of $10.2B is off 3.5% Y/Y, or 4.4% when accounting for higher ticket prices. Movie theater operators RGC, CNK, and MCS have poked out meager short-term returns, while 3-D specialist RLD is off 69% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • ADGE

    American DG Energy (ADGE +17.6%) pops after saying it's signed a $2M agreement to supply clean...

    American DG Energy (ADGE +17.6%) pops after saying it's signed a $2M agreement to supply clean energy to Governor Paterson Towers, a 225 unit, 30 story, residential high-rise, in Paterson, New Jersey.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • CHDX

    Chindex International (CHDX +7.1%) pops after saying it's appointed insiders Lawrence Pemble as...

    Chindex International (CHDX +7.1%) pops after saying it's appointed insiders Lawrence Pemble as COO, and Robert Low as CFO. Pemble will also retain his position as CFO of the company's joint venture, Chindex Medical, and Low will continue with his duties as chief accounting officer and controller in addition to the new assignment.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • GEO

    GEO Group (GEO -1.4%) says it signed a new, five-year contract with U.S. Immigration and Customs...

    GEO Group (GEO -1.4%) says it signed a new, five-year contract with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement for the continued management of a 1,900 bed South Texas Detention Center in Pearsall, Texas. The deal is projected to generate approximately $45M in annualized revenues.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • FST

    Forest Oil (FST -2.3%) dips with the rest of the sector, despite being initiated with an Add at...

    Forest Oil (FST -2.3%) dips with the rest of the sector, despite being initiated with an Add at Capital One. The firm says the stock has been beaten up lately, but it's showing signs of stabilization and the price is cheap at current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • NEM

    Some additional casualties of the selloff in precious metals today: Newmont Mining (NEM -1.7%),...

    Some additional casualties of the selloff in precious metals today: Newmont Mining (NEM -1.7%), Royal Gold (RGLD -3.8%), Kinross (KGC -3.4%), Yamana Gold (AUY -3.5%), IAMGold (IAG -4%), Golden Star Resources (GSS -3.9%), Gold Fields (GFI -2.7%) and Allied Nevada Gold (ANV -5.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • FTK

    Shares of oilfield technology company Flotek Industries (FTK -3.2%) reverse course - tracking...

    Shares of oilfield technology company Flotek Industries (FTK -3.2%) reverse course - tracking the overall weakness in the oil sector - erasing early morning gains after saying it will repurchase $36M of its senior secured convertible notes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.8%) surges after the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission says its...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.8%) surges after the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission says its environmental assessment of Cheniere's proposed natural gas liquefaction plant in Sabine Pass, LA leads it to conclude the plant won't have a major impact on the quality of the local environment.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • ENB

    Shares of Enbridge (ENB -1.8%) are trading lower after Canaccord cuts its rating to Hold, citing...

    Shares of Enbridge (ENB -1.8%) are trading lower after Canaccord cuts its rating to Hold, citing valuation. The stock has been a charger all year, gaining nearly 37% since the beginning of January.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • CASC-OLD

    Cascade (CASC-OLD -0.4%) outperforms the general market after being initiated with a Buy at...

    Cascade (CASC-OLD -0.4%) outperforms the general market after being initiated with a Buy at Global Hunter. The firm says it's the largest manufacturer of attachments for use on industrial lift trucks as well as construction, agricultural and mining related vehicles, and a leading player in the global market for materials handling equipment.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -5%) trades lower after being downgraded to Market Perform on...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -5%) trades lower after being downgraded to Market Perform on valuation at Northland Securities. Northland says the stock has posted a 130% gain since its Williston Basin acquisition in early October, and is nearing its $10 target. Other companies such as Voyager (VOG -1.4%), American Standard (ASEN flat) and Synergy (SYRG -1.8%) currently trade at a 30% relative discount and have more attractive valuations.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • XOM

    Energy stocks are down today, in line with modest declines in oil prices: Exxon Mobil (XOM -1%),...

    Energy stocks are down today, in line with modest declines in oil prices: Exxon Mobil (XOM -1%), Halliburton (HAL -1.7%), Marathon Oil (MRO -1.3%), Chevron (CVX -1.5%), BP (BP -1.5%), ConocoPhillips (COP -1.4%) and U.S. Oil ETF (USO -1.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • LVS

    Casino stocks are hit hard following yesterday's spike prompted by the Justice Department's...

    Casino stocks are hit hard following yesterday's spike prompted by the Justice Department's decision opening the door for states to pass laws allowing different forms of online gaming operated by lotteries and other gambling forums. LVS -3.3%, MPEL -3%, MGM -2.7%, WYNN -2.6%. BYD -2.5%; but PTEK +15%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • DLPH

    Recently-reborn Delphi Automotive (DLPH -1%) dips with the overall market, despite Credit Suisse...

    Recently-reborn Delphi Automotive (DLPH -1%) dips with the overall market, despite Credit Suisse initiating the stock with an Outperform this morning. The firm calls the new company the "bionic supplier: better, stronger, faster." Once on the brink of dissolution, it has emerged as a near perfect supplier with super-low cost structure and better products and a more diverse customer base.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • C

    Citigroup (C -3.1%) ends its 92-year presence in Belgium with the sale of its Belgian retail...

    Citigroup (C -3.1%) ends its 92-year presence in Belgium with the sale of its Belgian retail operations to French lender Credit Mutuel Nord Europe for an undisclosed price. The sale is part of Citi's strategy to pare non-core assets after the bank required more government support than many other financial institutions during the financial crisis.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • ANAC

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (ANAC -2.5%) files (S-3) a shelf registration with the SEC to sell up to...

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (ANAC -2.5%) files (S-3) a shelf registration with the SEC to sell up to $50M of a mix of common stock, preferred stock, debt securities, and warrants.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • END

    Rodman & Renshaw says Endeavour (END +11.2%) has more room to run, upping the driller to...

    Rodman & Renshaw says Endeavour (END +11.2%) has more room to run, upping the driller to Market Outperform and setting a $12.50 price target on the shares. The firm notes liquidity concerns and operational delays have caused the stock to lag its peers this year, but the issues have been largely resolved, and the stock is poised to move higher in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • EPRS

    Shares of Zalicus (ZLCS +2.5%) gain on positive comments out of Wedbush, reiterating its...

    Shares of Zalicus (ZLCS +2.5%) gain on positive comments out of Wedbush, reiterating its Outperform rating on the stock after the drug developer initiated Phase I trials for its Z944 pain treatment channel blocker earlier this month.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND +5.6%) is spiking higher, apparently on a rumor David Einhorn has acquired a...

    Diamond Foods (DMND +5.6%) is spiking higher, apparently on a rumor David Einhorn has acquired a stake in the controversy-laden company. Short-covering is likely playing a role.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • LEDS

    Beaten-down LED chipmaker SemiLEDs (LEDS +18.9%) is up sharply on strong volume. A possible...

    Beaten-down LED chipmaker SemiLEDs (LEDS +18.9%) is up sharply on strong volume. A possible trigger for the move is a Digitimes column stating Taiwanese LED vendors expect their shipments for lighting applications to grow in Q2, thanks to Samsung's expansion efforts. Given that SemiLEDs carried a short ratio of 3.5 as of Nov. 30, major news might not be necessary to spur a short-covering rally.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM

  • Gold and silver fall alongside the selloff in risk assets that began around 9:30 ET. Off 1.3% to...

    Gold and silver fall alongside the selloff in risk assets that began around 9:30 ET. Off 1.3% to $1,575/oz., gold is resting at a 3-month low. Technicians might see a bit of an air pocket beneath that support, with the next stop being around $1,500. Silver is off 4.7% to $27.57/oz., honing in on its January low in the $26 area.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 4 Comments
  • EMKR

    After selling off yesterday following its FQ4 report, Emcore (EMKR +21.4%) is soaring today....

    After selling off yesterday following its FQ4 report, Emcore (EMKR +21.4%) is soaring today. Though results missed estimates, and the company's FQ1 revenue guidance of $36M-$38M is well below a $51.2M consensus, investors appear to be taking heart in the company's prediction that optical and cable component production capacity lost to Thai flooding will be regained between March and May. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • CHK

    Investor sentiment about Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2.2%) "seems too negative," and the stock...

    Investor sentiment about Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2.2%) "seems too negative," and the stock offers "compelling risk/reward," Baird says. Worries that CHK will stray from its plan to trim debt, and that the oil-and-gas producer may not be able to complete $7B in joint ventures and other transactions set for 2012 are misplaced, the firm believes. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 6 Comments

  • The euro continues its near freefall, hitting $1.2944, the lowest level since the first days of...

    The euro continues its near freefall, hitting $1.2944, the lowest level since the first days of 2011 when it briefly fell below $1.29. Other risk currencies are down alongside, the British pound -1.3%; the aussie dollar, solidly higher minutes ago, -0.5% at $1.0107. European shares are at session lows, the Stoxx 50 -1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • HGIC

    Harleysville (HGIC -5.5%) shares sink after the insurance company rejects a takeover offer...

    Harleysville (HGIC -5.5%) shares sink after the insurance company rejects a takeover offer competing with an offer it accepted in September from Nationwide. The new offer provided $250M for some policy holders, who would not receive a payout in a Nationwide deal. The disclosure "could add to the challenges already raised against the merger," the Philadelphia Inquirer reports.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • DB

    Financials (XLF -0.8%) slip in early trading, particularly large European banks such as Deutsche...

    Financials (XLF -0.8%) slip in early trading, particularly large European banks such as Deutsche Bank (DB -3.2%) and Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS -2.7%). The news that European banks left record overnight deposits with the ECB indicates an unwillingness to lend to each other, overshadowing the successful Italian bond auctions. BAC -2.3%, C -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 2 Comments
  • WHR

    Shares of Whirlpool (WHR +2.1%) perk up on heavy volume after yesterday's steep selloff touched...

    Shares of Whirlpool (WHR +2.1%) perk up on heavy volume after yesterday's steep selloff touched off by troubles at Sears looks overdone to investors. Will Whirlpool's fortunes get a lift from improved consumer confidence or stay weighed down by a slumping housing market?

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • HDY

    Hyperdynamics (HDY +9.5%) shoots higher after stating it has resumed drilling operations at an...

    Hyperdynamics (HDY +9.5%) shoots higher after stating it has resumed drilling operations at an offshore gas well near Guinea in 10 days. Two weeks ago, Hyperdynamics said it had encountered "several mechanical and operational issues" that forced it to curtail drilling.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Shares of Molycorp (MCP -7.5%) fall off as investors try to read between the lines of China's...

    Shares of Molycorp (MCP -7.5%) fall off as investors try to read between the lines of China's rare earth export quotas for 2012. JPMorgan takes a slightly negative tone in maintaining a Neutral rating on MCP, saying it sees "additional pressure" on rare earth prices off a small Y/Y increase in quota levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 3 Comments
  • FTK

    Flotek Industries (FTK +2.1%) gains after the firm decides it will repurchase $36M of senior...

    Flotek Industries (FTK +2.1%) gains after the firm decides it will repurchase $36M of senior secured convertible notes. The company says it will draw on its cash balance to purchase the securities.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • ACAT

    Arctic Cat (NASDAQ:ACAT) jumps 22% higher after announcing a plan to buy back over 6M shares...

    Arctic Cat (NASDAQ:ACAT) jumps 22% higher after announcing a plan to buy back over 6M shares from Suzuki.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EK -4.3%) shares slide after an SEC filing reveals two directors from KKR have...

    Eastman Kodak (EK -4.3%) shares slide after an SEC filing reveals two directors from KKR have resigned from the company's board, two years after the PE firm helped Kodak refinance debt. The filing did not say why the two had resigned, but a WSJ report says they had grown frustrated with the pace of Kodak's turnaround.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • MRVL

    Off sharply yesterday following its Q4 warning, Cavium (CAVM -1.3%) is paring its losses after...

    Off sharply yesterday following its Q4 warning, Cavium (CAVM -1.3%) is paring its losses after multiple sell-side firms come to its defense. JPMorgan (Overweight) thinks low customer inventories, recent design wins, and improved orders from Cisco set the stage for a Q1 rebound, and Stifel (Buy) asserts Cavium's design wins with major telecom equipment firms position it to outperform its peers when demand returns.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM

  • With the euro plunging, the HAL 9000 takes over, knocking European shares off of their highs of...

    With the euro plunging, the HAL 9000 takes over, knocking European shares off of their highs of the day and into the red. Stoxx 50 -0.2%, led by Germany -0.5%. The euro takes out $1.30, now buying $1.2997.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • MN

    Shares of Manning & Napier (NYSE:MN) shoot up 4.3% premarket after the firm lands a Buy...

    Shares of Manning & Napier (NYSE:MN) shoot up 4.3% premarket after the firm lands a Buy rating from Stifel Nicolaus and an Outperform rating from Wells Fargo. Analysts with both firms point to the potential for organic growth for the independent investment management company.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • GPS

    Customer satisfaction matters: After a shaky result in ForSee's poll of online shoppers on their...

    Customer satisfaction matters: After a shaky result in ForSee's poll of online shoppers on their experience during the holiday season, shares of Gap (NYSE:GPS) trade 3.3% lower in premarket action.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • EJ

    Chinese real estate service provider E-House (NYSE:EJ) has agreed to acquire all outstanding...

    Chinese real estate service provider E-House (NYSE:EJ) has agreed to acquire all outstanding shares of subsidiary China Real Estate Information Corp. (NASDAQ:CRIC) it doesn't own (it presently has a 54.1% stake)  for $1.75/share in cash and 0.6 E-House shares. The deal currently values CRIC at $4.30/share, a 5.6% premium to Tuesday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • NBL

    Noble Energy (NYSE:NBL) rises 1.4% after announcing it has made a "significant natural gas...

    Noble Energy (NYSE:NBL) rises 1.4% after announcing it has made a "significant natural gas discovery" in a well off the coast of Cyprus. Noble has a 70% stake in the well.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM | 2 Comments
